feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GRA2][Network] - Network equipment operation
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 28, 20:00 - 23:59 UTC

Sep 14, 19:34 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 28/09/2022 20:00 UTC
End time : 28/09/2022 23:59 UTC
Service impact : Loss of all services behind the concerned devices for 30 minutes each one.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on some network equipment.

entry.title: [GRA2][Dedicated Servers] - G223A10 / G223A11 / G223A12
entry.content:
Sep 16, 14:09 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 16/09/2022 06:27 UTC
End Time : 16/09/2022 14:06 UTC
Service impact : Servers were unreachable in racks G223A10, G223A11 and G223A12
Root cause : The incident was caused by a problem with the cooling system.

Sep 16, 13:27 UTC
Update - Update : Servers in racks G223A10 and G223A11 are all reachable. But some servers are still unreachable in rack G223A12.
Our teams are still working on the problem.

Sep 16, 10:02 UTC
Update - Update : Our teams always work to provide you with services as soon as possible. There are still 16 servers unavailable.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Sep 16, 08:55 UTC
Update - Update : The fix is in progress, there are still 3 servers on the G223A11 rack, 14 servers on the G223A12 rack and 2 servers on the G223A10 still unavailable.

Sep 16, 08:03 UTC
Update - Update : All servers on rack G223A11 are now impacted.
14 servers on the rack G223A12 are impacted and 2 servers on rack G223A10 also seem to be impacted by the incident.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are still on site to provide you with services as soon as possible.

Sep 16, 07:11 UTC
Identified - Start time : 16/09/2022 06:27 UTC
Service impact : 24 servers in racks G223A11 and G223A12 are unavailable.
Root cause : The incident was caused by a problem with the cooling system.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are currently working to provide you with services as soon as possible.

Root cause : This incident was caused by a tripped circuit breaker.
